subject: Communication
title: Psychological Safety: Leading by Listening
description: One-minute skill: Psychological Safety: Leading by Listening.

hook.text: Google studied 180 teams to find what made the best ones. Number one factor?

buildup.text: Amy Edmondson defined psychological safety: a shared belief that the team is safe for risk-taking and speaking up.

discovery.text: Leaders create psychological safety primarily through listening behaviors: asking questions, acknowledging.

twist.text: A leader who says 'my door is always open' but checks their phone during conversations destroys psychological safety.

climax.text: The highest-performing teams aren't the smartest. They're the ones where everyone feels heard.

punchline.text: Teams don't fail from lack of talent. They fail when people stop speaking up.

quiz.question: What did Google's research find was the #1 factor in team effectiveness?
